scan_linter_check.description: The use of the constructor of the Javascript Date class is problematic. The default behavior is the initialization with the current date and time. Sometimes the use of functions like setMonth() or setUTCMonth() may not produce expected results if the set date is at the end of a month.
scan_linter_check.name: CodeSanity - Date() without parameter
scan_linter_check.resolution_details: Refactor code in a way that the Date class is initialized explicitly so that it is perfectly clear what the intention is. E.g. to initialize a Date object with the current date and time use "new Date(Date.now())" - which is technically redundant, but explicit.
scan_linter_check.short_description: Do not use the constructor of Date() without parameters
